function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Qualitative research dominance","Impact":"May limit the understanding of quantitative and empirical data related to contagious disease propagation.","Mitigation":"Encourage the use of a mixed-methods approach to research, combining qualitative and quantitative methods for a more comprehensive understanding.","Technologies":"Mixed-methods research approach, data integration tools.","People":"Researchers, policymakers, public health officials.","Owner":"Research institutions, funding agencies, academic journals."},{"Description":"Lack of supply chain structure specification","Impact":"Difficulty in identifying potential points of disease transmission within supply chains.","Mitigation":"Encourage detailed documentation and reporting of supply chain structures to facilitate risk identification and mitigation strategies.","Technologies":"Supply chain mapping software, data visualization tools.","People":"Supply chain managers, logistics professionals, public health officials.","Owner":"Supply chain companies, regulatory authorities, industry associations."},{"Description":"Data availability and reliability challenges related to COVID-19 impact","Impact":"Hindrance in accurately assessing the impact of COVID-19 on global supply networks and contagious disease propagation.","Mitigation":"Invest in data collection and verification processes, promote collaboration for data sharing and analysis.","Technologies":"Data collection tools, analytics platforms, collaborative data sharing platforms.","People":"Data analysts, researchers, public health agencies.","Owner":"Government agencies, international organizations, research institutions."}]}
